isis.stitle: DIAMONDLIFE™ (BOSCH PIN SLIDE) DISC BRAKES For Vehicles Built After June 2, 2002 - REMOVE - ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD

svcprocinfo.para: The caliper, anchor plate tie bar, if so equipped (73 mm brake assembly only) and hub and rotor must be removed before the anchor plate and splash shield can be removed.

During service procedure, keep grease and other foreign material from caliper assembly, disc brake pads, brake rotor and external surfaces of wheel hub. Handle parts carefully to avoid damage to caliper, rotor, disc brake pads and brake lines.
In the event the original disc brake pads are to be used again, be sure to mark them in some manner so that they are reinstalled in same location.
The following steps refer to only one wheel. The same procedure will need to be performed at each wheel.

svcsubproc.title: Remove

step1.para: Position vehicle on suitable floor stands and remove wheel (tire and rim). Refer to GROUP 17- WHEELS in the Master Service Manual for proper wheel removal.

warning.para: A jack must never be used alone to support a vehicle while under-chassis service is being performed. The jack may lower and serious personal injury could result. Always support vehicle with suitable floor stands.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 34 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove anchor plate tie bar (Item 1), if so equipped (73 mm brake assembly only), from anchor plate (Item 2) by removing 12-point head bolts (Item 3), and lay it out of the way. Save for reinstallation.

Remove caliper assembly (Item 4). Refer to CALIPER, Remove
.

figure.caption: Figure 34. Install Anchor Plate Tie Bar

step1.para:
Remove rotor and wheel hub assembly (Items 1 and 2, Figure 35), driver side front shown. Refer to ROTOR AND WHEEL HUB ASSEMBLY, Remove
.

figure.caption: Figure 35. Remove Rotor and Wheel Hub Assembly

step1.para:
Before removing the anchor plate and splash shield from the steering knuckle flange (Item 4, Figure 36)
you must remove the ABS sensor (if so equipped) from the ABS sensor bracket (Item 1, Figure 43) .

caution.para: When removing the ABS sensor from the ABS sensor bracket on the anchor plate, use your thumb and fore-finger to get hold of the rear of the sensor where the cable enters the sensor. Use extreme caution not to pull on the cable while twisting and pulling at the same time to remove the sensor.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 36 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: On front axles with both 66 mm and 73 mm disc brakes, remove anchor plate and splash shield (Items 1 and 2) by removing hex lock nuts (Item 3) from inboard side of steering knuckle flange (Item 4).

Remove hex bolts (Item 5 ) and anchor plate and splash shield (Items 1 and 2) from outboard side of steering knuckle flange (Item 4). Place anchor plate, splash shield and mounting hardware on a clean, dry surface out of the way and save for reinstallation.

figure.caption: Figure 36. Remove Front Anchor Plate and Splash Panel

step1.para:
Before removing the anchor plate and splash shield from the rear axle flange (Item 6, Figure 37)
you must remove the ABS sensor (if so equipped) from the ABS sensor bracket (Item 1, Figure 43) .

caution.para: When removing the ABS sensor from the ABS sensor bracket on the anchor plate, use your thumb and fore-finger to get hold of the rear of the sensor where the cable enters the sensor. Use extreme caution not to pull on the cable while twisting and pulling at the same time to remove the sensor.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 37 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: On rear axles with both 66 mm and 73 mm disc brakes, remove anchor plate and splash shield (Items 1 and 2) by removing hex lock nuts with flat washers (Items 3 and 4) from outboard side of anchor plate.

Remove hex bolts (Item 5) from inboard side and anchor plate and splash shield (Items 1 and 2) from outboard side of axle flange (Item 6). Place anchor plate, splash shield and mounting hardware on a clean dry surface out of the way and save for reinstallation.

figure.caption: Figure 37. Remove Rear Anchor Plate and Splash Shield

calloutgroup.callout1: DRIVER SIDE REAR (66 mm AND 73 mm) SHOWN

step1.para:
Once the anchor plate and splash shield is removed and placed on a clean dry work surface, refer to ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD, Disassemble
, ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD, Clean and Inspect
and ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD, Assemble
to disassemble, clean and inspect and assemble to repair or rebuild anchor plate and splash shield.
